person.persName: Barton Potter (Clay County, Kentucky, merchant, postmaster, and farmer.)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, merchant, postmaster, and farmer. Rhode Island native. Married to Elizabeth Potter. Father of Lorenda Potter, Robert G. Potter, and James Potter. Resident of Clay County in 1840. Owned four enslaved persons in Clay County in 1840. Postmaster for Manchester in Clay County from September 24, 1846, to December 10, 1851. Merchant in Clay County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Clay County in 1850. Owned Julia [Unknown] and Martha [Unknown] in Clay County in 1855. Owned Sally [Unknown] and Harriet [Unknown] in Clay County in 1856. Farmer in Clay County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Clay County in 1860.
